Visualize the NMF basis vectors as a heatmap

Source: R/viz_basis_vectors_as_heatmap.R
viz_basis_vectors_as_heatmap.Rd

Each factor in the given features matrix is separately represented as a heatmap. Since each feeature vector is a one-hot-encoded DNA sequence, it is reshaped to have 4 rows and then visualized.

viz_basis_vectors_as_heatmap(
  featuresMatrix,
  position_labels = NA,
  add_pseudo_counts = FALSE,
  savePDFfilename = NULL,
  sinuc_or_dinuc = "sinuc"
)

Arguments

featuresMatrix

The features matrix output from NMF. Expected dimensionality: number of columns represent the number of factors from NMF, and the number of rows is 4 times the length of the sequences in the collection.
position_labels

Labels of the positions in the sequences.
add_pseudo_counts

Boolean, taking values TRUE/T or FALSE/F, default set to FALSE. Setting it to TRUE will enable adding pseudo-counts to the features matrix.
savePDFfilename

Name of the file which will be saved as PDF (also provide the extension).
sinuc_or_dinuc

"sinuc" or "dinuc"

Value

nothing.

See also

viz_basis_vectors_as_seqlogo for plotting only as sequence logos, viz_basis_vectors_in_combined_heatmaps_seqlogos for plotting combined heatmaps and sequence logos.

Other visualization functions: plot_ggheatmap(), plot_ggseqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_as_seqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_in_combined_heatmaps_seqlogos(), viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_ohe(), viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_seqs()
